newsitem.title: USA: Intersolv sees Q4, year loss from charge.
newsitem.headline: Intersolv sees Q4, year loss from charge.

text.p: INTERSOLV Inc said Tuesday it expects to report a net loss for both the fourth quarter and fiscal year ending April 30, 1997 because of a $25 million to $30 million pre-tax charge.

Wall Street had been expecting the company to report fourth quarter earnings of $0.22 per share and full-year earnings of $0.45 per share, according to First Call consensus estimates. The company said attributed the expected loss to the charge, which it said was needed to write down certain capitalized software costs and other intangible assets.
It said the adjustment reduces certain assets to their expected future net value.
"As a result of the rapid technological changes affecting the company's products, INTERSOLV anticipates to capitalize significantly lower amounts in the future," it added in a release.

The company, which makes application enablement software for client/server, Internet and intranet, said it decided to increase its focus on core markets and products providing the best growth opportunities after a recent evaluation of its product and business strategies. It said it would report final results by the first week of June.
